metadata.title: CVE-2018-10876 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Linux kernel in the ext4 filesystem code. Ause-after-free is possible in ext4_ext_remove_space() function whenmounting and operating a crafted ext4 image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10876` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-134-generic - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-lowlatency - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-4.4.0-134-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-134.160
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-134-generic - 4.4.0-134.160
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1095-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1095.103
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1099.104
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1066-aws - 4.4.0-1066.76
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-45-generic - 4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-45-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-45-lowlatency - 4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-45-generic - 4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-45-lowlatency - 4.15.0-45.48~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-azure - 4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-gcp - 4.15.0-1027.28~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1032-kvm - 4.4.0-1032.38
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1032-aws - 4.15.0-1032.34~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1008-oracle - 4.15.0-1008.10~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1008-fips - 4.4.0-1008.10
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1008-fips - 4.4.0-1008.10

linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1008-fips - 4.4.0-1008.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-134.160').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1095.103').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1099.104').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.76').

linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.28~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1032.38').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
